newsitem.title: USA: Georgia, S. Carolina ports close due to hurricane.
newsitem.headline: Georgia, S. Carolina ports close due to hurricane.

text.p: Ports from Savannah, Georgia, to Charleston, South Carolina have been closed to vessel traffic until the threat of Hurricane Fran passes, the Coast Guard said Wednesday.
The Savannah Marine Safety Office said ports Savannah and Brunswick closed Tuesday afternoon followed by ports Royal and Charleston in South Carolina on Wednesday afternoon.
The majority of traffic through the ports are container and bulk vessels. Officials said they did not know if any vessels carrying crude oil or bunker fuel have been affected.
"The Port of Charleston is closed but those north of it are not yet in the strike area and are still open," said a Savannah Coast Guard official.
Earlier Wednesday, refineries along the Eastern Seaboard, especially in Delaware and Pennsylvania, said they were monitoring Hurricane Fran but have not yet taken any precautionary measures.
As of 1823EDT, Hurricane Fran was about 410 miles southeast of Charleston, S.C., packing maximum sustained winds of 115 mph.
The category three winds are traveling northwest at 12 mph and "should stay on that course through the next day," said Mike Arellano of Weather Research Center.
Arellano said hurricane-like conditions are likely to hit areas from north of Brunswick, Ga., to Cape Lookout, N.C., in 24 hours.
